Diagnosis. Adult (Fig. 11) with wingspan 6.0−11.0 mm. This species is similar to Hieromantis ephodophora Meyrick, 1897 by having similar forewing markings, but Hieromantis kurokoi can be separated by the valva having a rounded cucullus in the male genitalia (Fig. 16); and the appendix bursae about the same length as the corpus bursae in the female genitalia (Fig. 22). In Hieromantis ephodophora , the cucullus is subtriangular, and the appendix bursae is about four times length of the corpus bursae ( Kasy 1973 : Figs 97-98).
